citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
On 22APR2025 an older lioness (Isabella), and older lion (Jabri), and a black African leopard (Onyx) were observed with
decreased muscle mass with hips, ribs, and spine prominently displayed under the skin. These animals were observed in
this same condition by the previous USDA inspection team on 01APR2025. These animals have not been evaluated or
treated by the attending veterinarian to diagnose any dietary insufficiency, diseases, or injuries accounting for the loss of
body condition. At the time of this inspection the office of the Attending Veterinarian (AV) advised there has been no
communication by the facility to examine or treat these animals since the last routine inspection on 01APR2025. Each
dealer or exhibitor must have a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending veterinarian so that
timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Ashley Alger, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3)  Direct Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
On 22APR2025 an older lioness (Isabella), and older lion (Jabri), and a black African leopard (Onyx) were observed with 
decreased muscle mass with hips, ribs, and spine prominently displayed under the skin. These animals were observed in 
this same condition by the previous USDA inspection team on 01APR2025. These animals have not been evaluated or 
treated by the attending veterinarian to diagnose any dietary insufficiency, diseases, or injuries accounting for the loss of 
body condition. At the time of this inspection the office of the Attending Veterinarian (AV) advised there has been no 
communication by the facility to examine or treat these animals since the last routine inspection on 01APR2025. Each 
dealer or exhibitor must have a mechanism of direct and frequent communication with the attending veterinarian so that 
timely and accurate information on problems of animal health, behavior, and well-being is conveyed. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Ashley Alger, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
